column2: maximus640, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had a head injury during basic training 1972, after completing my military service during the Viet Nam War 6 months after my discharge I began to have seizures for no reason, I was told I had epilepsy but we recently found out that my head injury might have been a consussion and I had returned to duty too soon. I have been on dilantin since and tranxene which helps greatly, especially when I feel a seizure comming on sometimes I can take tranxene and ward off the seizure. Lately I have been on atavin but it doesn't work as well for seizures.

column2: Adrian, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I'm an RN and was very impressed by what I've read about this medication, especially the long half-life which decreases the chance of tolerance or addiction. Seems like this would be a great medication for generalized anxiety but I just didn't have much luck with it.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: MINDSCI, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Tranxene (Clorazepate 7.5mg T.I.D) for over a year now. I started it for Chronic Anxiety & Stress Over-Reactivity. It has worked extremely well. Moreover, it has not lost its effectiveness at the same dose- no tolerance! Within 2 weeks of starting Tranxene I noticed my fingernails had started to grow out! I had always bitten them all off till they bled since I was 4-5 years old. I no longer dread answering the door or phone, nor have ruminating anxious thoughts. The Tranxene is also an Anti-Seizure Medication; consequently, it allowed me to drop Lamictal, a Sodium Channel Blocker, from my Seizure Med List.  The Lamictal and all the Sodium Channel Blockers (Tegretol, Trieptal, etc.) always caused me too much Cognitive Fogging. Tranxene is a PRODRUG which is quickly converted to NorDiazepam, a Benzodiazepine, which has a half life of 45-75 hours. As such, steady state levels of Nordiazepam are reached within several days of initial dosing. In my experience, there is No "Cognitive Fogging"; No "High", No "Amnesiac Effect",and No "Sedative/Hypnotic Effect" which are all to common with other Benzodiazepine drugs. As a Neuroscientist I cannot tolerate the Side Effects of any of the more commonly prescribed Anxiolytics and Anti-epileptics. It's too bad the Vast Majority of M.D.'s are not aware that TRANXENE and some other Benzodiazepines are not very addictive- contrary to popular "Medical Community" belief. See:Textbook of PsychopharmacologyAmerican Psychiatric Publishing, Inc.; 4 edition (May 6, 2009) Pages: 474-478.

column2: knotart, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: This drug is prescribed for reasons other than Anxiety. After being diagnosed with PPS, Post Polio Syndrome, my Doc suggested I try this drug for muscle spasms & neuro-transmitters (spelling)nerves sending crossed signals through my body. It works better & is less harmful & addicting as narcotic pain pills. It helps with migraines, sleep problems, muscles, tendon & joint pains, even bone pains. I do not experience any negative side affects or withdrawals when I cannot afford them or go without them because Medicare or Humana Insurance no longer cover this drug. I have a friend with MS-she says it helps her tremendously. WHY HAS INSURANCE STOPPED PAYING FOR THIS VERY HELPFUL DRUG ?????

column2: vjtesitor, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I was put on this in 1982 when my blood pressure spiked because of divorce.  I took it daily for about 4 years with no adverse effects, slept like a baby!  Quit taking it with no withdrawls at all.  In 1990 I had a hysterectomy and asked my doctor to prescribe it again.  They will only give me 30 at a time but has not been a problem.  I get a new prescription for it about every year and a half.  I only take it when I am really stressed and it works like a charm! I had been given antidepressants since my female surgery for "hot flashes" which they did nothing for me except make me depressed!  I weened myself off the last one, Zoloft, about a month ago only because I could not afford to go to the doctor and get a new script.  I found that when I was totally off of it my emotional state improved 100%!!!  The tranxene has helped with a few of those withdrawl jitters but only took a few.  Love the stuff!!!

xxhondagirl06xx@aol.com, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: Was prescribed to my eighty year old grandmother. This is mainly her docs fault. But she has since had major sleeping spells where she is unresponsive, went to hospital for it, fell and hurt herself, nursing home, and now is back home and has fell again and requires full care. I started digging trying to find cause and this med had just been prescribed. In her spells when she wouldn't wake* she also could not speak* and when did, it came out slurred*. Her walking* became a problem. Before being prescribed to this she was fully independent. I just wanted to review so that maybe if another elderly is taking this maybe it will warn them if they begin seeing these symptoms. It may also prevent an elderly from continuing this prescription after seeing the first symptoms and taking the same road grandma has. Hope it saves someone.(not a negetive review it did help her nerves as im sure it does many people. just be weary with giving to elderly)
